content.text:
TS2322: Type '{ children: Element[]; variant: "splitted"; defaultExpandedKeys: string[]; classNames: { base: string; }; }' is not assignable to type 'IntrinsicAttributes & MergeWithAs<Omit<DetailedHTMLProps<HTMLAttributes<HTMLDivElement>, HTMLDivElement>, "ref">, Omit<...>, AccordionProps, "div">'.
  Property 'classNames' does not exist on type 'IntrinsicAttributes & MergeWithAs<Omit<DetailedHTMLProps<HTMLAttributes<HTMLDivElement>, HTMLDivElement>, "ref">, Omit<...>, AccordionProps, "div">'. Did you mean 'className'?

TS2322: Type '{ children: Element[]; variant: "splitted"; defaultExpandedKeys: string[]; classNames: { base: string; }; }' is not assignable to type 'IntrinsicAttributes & MergeWithAs<Omit<DetailedHTMLProps<HTMLAttributes<HTMLDivElement>, HTMLDivElement>, "ref">, Omit<...>, AccordionProps, "div">'.
  Property 'classNames' does not exist on type 'IntrinsicAttributes & MergeWithAs<Omit<DetailedHTMLProps<HTMLAttributes<HTMLDivElement>, HTMLDivElement>, "ref">, Omit<...>, AccordionProps, "div">'. Did you mean 'className'?

# Explanation

## Why the error occurs
The TypeScript typings for `Accordion` from `@heroui/react` expose the usual HTML props (such as `className`) plus the component-specific `AccordionProps`. They do **not** define a `classNames` prop for the top-level `Accordion`. Because of that, assigning an object to `classNames` results in `TS2322`, which is TypeScriptâ€™s way of telling you that youâ€™re passing an unsupported prop. (Other components like `Avatar` *do* support `classNames`, so the mismatch isnâ€™t immediately obvious.)

## How to fix it
1. Replace the `classNames` prop on the `Accordion` with the standard `className` prop.
2. Keep `classNames` (or other slot-based props) only on the components that actually support themâ€”`AccordionItem` does, but the container `Accordion` does not.

### Updated snippet
```tsx
<Accordion
    variant="splitted"
    defaultExpandedKeys={["0"]}
    className="gap-4"
>
    {/* ...items */}
</Accordion>
```

---

> **Heads-up:** I couldnâ€™t find the usual repository metadata file at `C:/Users/Atharv Mishra/Desktop/z/.zencoder/rules/repo.md`. If you create it (it can be generated automatically), future assistance can be more accurate.
